meanings.definition: To disturb the composure of; unsettle
meanings.sent3: The magician's disappearing act disconcerts the audience.
meanings.sent4: The sudden change in weather disconcerts the picnic plans.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the abandoned house disconcerts visitors.

meanings.sent1: Her constant interruptions disconcert our study group.
meanings.sent2: The technical issues disconcerted the team's progress.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat disconcerts the dog's attempts to nap.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected rain disconcerted our outdoor event.
meanings.sent5: The missing ingredient disconcerted the chef's recipe.

meanings.definition: To throw into disorder or confusion
meanings.sent1: The messy room disconcerts her sense of order.
meanings.sent2: The conflicting instructions disconcerted the new employees.
meanings.sent3: The jumbled words disconcert the young reader.
meanings.sent4: The maze of corridors disconcerted the lost travelers.
meanings.sent5: The complex puzzle disconcerts even the experienced solver.
